title.rendered: How to Prevent Clogged Drains: Simple Tips for a Smooth-Running Home

content.rendered:
Clogged drains are one of the most common plumbing issues homeowners face, but the good news is that they’re largely preventable! Start by being mindful of what goes down your drains—avoid pouring grease, coffee grounds, or food scraps into the sink. Regularly clean your sink stoppers and strainers to catch debris before it becomes a problem. It’s also a good idea to flush your drains with hot water and a mixture of baking soda and vinegar once a month to keep them clear. By following these simple tips, you can save yourself from the headache and cost of dealing with a clogged drain!
